example.question: Nutrient-laden waters from heavy rains flow into the Gulf of Mexico. This produces an algae bloom in the ocean environment. As the algae decays, it uses up large amounts of oxygen along the coastline. Which will most likely happen to the area as a result?

text: Nitrogen will replace oxygen in the water.
The temperature of the water will increase.
Wave action will carry away the dead algae.
Bottom dwellers will die and fish will swim away.
label: A

prompt:
Accurately answer the following question:

Nutrient-laden waters from heavy rains flow into the Gulf of Mexico. This produces an algae bloom in the ocean environment. As the algae decays, it uses up large amounts of oxygen along the coastline. Which will most likely happen to the area as a result?

Choices:
A. Nitrogen will replace oxygen in the water.
B. The temperature of the water will increase.
C. Wave action will carry away the dead algae.
D. Bottom dwellers will die and fish will swim away.


Instructions:
- Carefully read the question and all options.
- Select the single most correct answer.
- Respond ONLY in the following format: "The correct answer is A/B/C/D".
- Do not include any explanations, additional text, or punctuation besides the answer.

The correct answer is
